item.title: 斯洛伐克总理菲科呼吁暂停欧洲旗舰碳市场
item.description: 斯洛伐克总理呼吁暂停欧盟减少碳排放的核心机制，称此举对于缓解工业压力、提升欧盟竞争力至关重要。【原文：Slovakia’s prime minister called for a suspension of the European Union’s central instrument to reduce carbon emissions, arguing the move is necessary to ease pressure on industry and boost the bloc’s competitiveness.】

item.title: 英格兰银行行长贝利为银行辩护，反对对量化宽松利润征税
item.description: 英国央行高官表示，对英国贷款机构在央行持有的资产所获利润征税，将威胁金融稳定并推高家庭抵押贷款成本。【原文：Taxing the profits made by UK lenders from their holdings at the Bank of England would threaten financial stability and drive up mortgage costs for households, top BOE officials said.】

item.title: 黄金避险需求如何推动价格创下历史新高
item.description: 数个世纪以来，黄金始终是政治经济动荡时期最可靠的避险资产。作为一种价值稳定、便于携带且全球通用的商品，当万物动荡时，它总能带来安全感。【原文：For centuries, gold has been the go-to haven asset in times of political and economic uncertainty. Its status as a reliably high-value commodity that can be transported easily and sold anywhere offers a sense of safety when everything else is in turmoil.】

item.title: 马里黄金产量去年因与巴里克公司纠纷大幅下滑
item.description: 马里去年工业黄金产量下降23%，此前执政的军事政权与巴里克黄金公司发生纠纷，导致该国最大金矿停产。【原文：Mali’s industrial gold output fell 23% last year, after a dispute between the ruling military junta and Barrick Mining Corp. shut the country’s largest operation.】

item.title: 贝森特与日本建立联系，美国国债市场动荡不安
item.description: 财政部长斯科特·贝森特表示，他已与日本同行进行沟通。此前日本国债遭遇抛售，他称这波抛售已蔓延至美国国债市场。【原文：Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said he had spoken with his Japanese counterpart amid a selloff in Japan’s government bonds that he said had fed through to affect the Treasuries market.】

item.title: 埃克佩特罗尔公司考虑进口天然气，若特朗普放宽对委内瑞拉制裁
item.description: 据知情人士透露，哥伦比亚国有能源公司正着手恢复从邻国委内瑞拉进口天然气的初步工作，预计美国将放宽制裁。【原文：Colombia’s state energy company is taking preliminary steps to resume importing natural gas from neighboring Venezuela in anticipation that the US will ease sanctions, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 日本经济官僚片山由久呼吁债券抛售风暴后市场保持冷静
item.description: 日本财务大臣片山绫子呼吁市场参与者保持冷静。此前，债券市场经历了激烈抛售，导致长期国债收益率升至数十年高位，其影响波及全球其他市场。【原文：Japanese Finance Minister Satsuki Katayama called on market participants to calm down after an intense day of bond selling pushed up yields on long-term government debt to the highest levels in decades with ripples reaching other global markets.】

item.title: 保险平台Ethos及其支持者寻求2.11亿美元IPO融资
item.description: 保险平台Ethos Technologies Inc.及其部分投资者正计划通过首次公开募股筹集约2.11亿美元，成为最新一家即将上市的保险相关企业。【原文：Insurance platform Ethos Technologies Inc. and some of its backers are seeking to raise about $211 million in an initial public offering, the latest insurance-related firm set to debut.】

item.title: 安联高管敦促欧盟利用市场波动向美国施压
item.description: 安联全球投资者公司一位高管表示，欧洲政策制定者应助长市场动荡，以此向美国总统唐纳德·特朗普施压，迫使其放弃对格陵兰岛的主张。【原文：European policymakers should fuel market turbulence to pressure US President Donald Trump to back down from his Greenland claim, according to a senior executive at Allianz Global Investors.】

item.title: Ericsson CEO Says Europe’s Tech Sovereignty Push Is ‘Dangerous’
item.description: 瑞典电信设备制造商爱立信公司负责人表示，欧洲推动减少对美国技术的依赖将损害该集团利益，而与此同时，特朗普总统的格陵兰政策正疏远盟友。【原文：The European push to become less dependent on US technology will hurt the bloc even as President Donald Trump’s Greenland policy alienates allies, according to the head of Swedish telecom equipment maker Ericsson AB.】

item.title: Batistas’ PicPay Fintech Seeks $2.5 Billion Market Cap in US IPO
item.description: Picpay Holdings Netherlands BV, the Brazilian fintech controlled by the billionaire Batista family, is seeking to raise more than $400 million in what could be the first initial public offering out of the country in four years.

item.title: Gopinath Points to Danger of a US Inflation Comeback in 2026
item.description: The US economy is vulnerable to a snapback in consumer-price growth because of everything from fiscal stimulus to the weakness of the dollar, according to Harvard University Professor Gita Gopinath.

item.title: Russian Oil Exports Plunge to 4-Month Low as India Shuns Cargoes
item.description: December imports of Moscow’s crude into India were the lowest in more than three years

item.title: AI Agents ‘Perilous’ for Secure Apps Such as Signal, Whittaker Says
item.description: Artificial intelligence agents that autonomously carry out tasks pose a threat to secure apps such as Signal, according to Meredith Whittaker, president of the Signal Foundation.

item.title: 麦格理资本发行与10亿美元私募贷款挂钩的结构性票据
item.description: 麦格理资本完成了一项与高收益企业贷款相关的重要风险转移，这标志着非银行贷款机构罕见地进军该市场。【原文：Macquarie Capital completed a significant risk transfer tied to high-yield corporate loans, in a rare example of a non-bank lender making a foray into the market.】

item.title: 丹麦养老基金AkademikerPension将退出美国国债
item.description: 丹麦养老基金AkademikerPension计划在本月底前退出美国国债投资，因担忧特朗普总统的政策已引发不容忽视的信用风险。【原文：The Danish pension fund AkademikerPension is planning to exit US Treasuries by the end of the month, amid concerns that the policies of President Donald Trump have created credit risks too big to ignore.】

item.title: 中国在达沃斯捍卫经济模式，力争成为世界市场
item.description: 中国国务院副总理何立峰加强了对本国经济成就的辩护，同时提出将进一步开放国内市场以缓解贸易失衡的设想。【原文：Chinese Vice Premier He Lifeng stepped up a defense of his country’s economic track record, dangling the prospect of greater access to its domestic market to reduce imbalances in trade.】

item.title: 非洲最大贷款机构标准银行人才流失至南非联合银行
item.description: 标准银行集团有限公司——按资产规模计算的非洲最大贷款机构——即将再有两名高管跳槽至规模较小的竞争对手南非联合银行集团有限公司。【原文：Standard Bank Group Ltd., Africa’s largest lender by assets, is set to lose two more top executives to smaller rival Absa Group Ltd.】

item.title: 俄罗斯在黄金涨势中获利2160亿美元，弥补了损失的资产
item.description: 自俄罗斯对乌克兰发动战争以来，金价飙升使其意外获利，其规模堪比因普京总统入侵而被欧洲冻结的主权储备。【原文：Russia has reaped a windfall from a surge in gold prices since the start of its war in Ukraine, generating gains on a scale comparable to the sovereign reserves frozen in Europe over President Vladimir Putin’s invasion.】

item.title: 波兰考虑禁止中国制造的汽车进入其军事基地
item.description: 据波兰副国防部长透露，该国可能禁止中国制造的汽车进入军事设施，以保护其安全。【原文：Poland may ban Chinese-made cars from entering military facilities in an effort to protect its security, according to a deputy defense minister.】

item.title: 格陵兰与日本地震冲击华尔街平静
item.description: 数周以来，华尔街热议的话题是今年开年市场异常平静。但随着格陵兰岛争端使欧美联盟陷入混乱，加之日本国债暴跌，这份平静正在被打破。【原文：For weeks, the talk on Wall Street was how markets have been unusually subdued at the start of the year. But with a clash over Greenland throwing the European and American alliance in disarray and Japanese bonds plunging, the calm is breaking.】

item.title: 英伟达与SV Angel将以44.8亿美元估值投资Humans&
item.description: 人类公司（Humans&）是一家正在建立前沿人工智能实验室的新创企业，其种子轮融资额达4.8亿美元，估值高达44.8亿美元——对于初创企业而言，这笔融资规模实属罕见。【原文：Humans&, a new startup building a frontier artificial intelligence lab, has raised a $480 million seed funding round at a $4.48 billion valuation — an unusually large haul for a young startup.】

item.title: 阿根廷Pomelo公司完成5500万美元融资，将用于提升支付服务能力
item.description: 阿根廷金融科技初创企业Pomelo在C轮融资中筹集了5500万美元，旨在通过推出与稳定币和实时代理支付相关的新产品，深化其在拉丁美洲的业务布局并拓展全球市场。【原文：Argentina-based financial technology startup Pomelo has raised $55 million in a Series C round as it looks to deepen its presence in Latin America and expand globally with new products tied to stablecoins and real-time agentic payments.】

item.title: 奈飞将华纳兄弟交易的过桥贷款增至420亿美元
item.description: 奈飞公司已从华尔街银行获得更多债务融资，以支持其修订后的全现金收购方案，该方案旨在收购华纳兄弟探索公司的影视制作及流媒体业务。【原文：Netflix Inc. has lined up more debt from Wall Street banks to help finance its amended, all-cash agreement to buy Warner Bros. Discovery Inc.’s studio and streaming business.】

item.title: 沙特债券借款额突破200亿美元，创1月新高
item.description: 自年初以来，沙特阿拉伯已售出逾200亿美元的国际债券，创下1月份的最高纪录，企业与银行正加入政府融资行列。【原文：Saudi Arabia sold more than $20 billion of international bonds since the start of the year, a record for a January as companies and banks join government fund raising.】

item.title: 波兰央行批准购入150吨黄金计划
item.description: 波兰国家银行周二宣布，已批准一项购买最多150吨黄金的计划，此举将使该国黄金储备增至700吨。【原文：The National Bank of Poland approved a plan to buy as much as 150 tons of gold, which would increase the country’s holdings to 700 tons, the central bank said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 阿联酋达赫拉公司退出谷物贸易，计划转向农业领域
item.description: 总部位于阿布扎比的农业企业集团Al Dahra Holding计划退出第三方谷物和油籽贸易业务，转而专注于其遍布欧洲、非洲和美国的农业运营。【原文：Abu Dhabi-based agribusiness group Al Dahra Holding plans to exit third-party grains and oilseeds trading, pivoting instead to focus on its farming operations spread across Europe, Africa and the US.】

item.title: 美国股指期货下跌，因格陵兰威胁加剧贸易担忧
item.description: 美国股市期货创下11月以来最大跌幅，此前特朗普总统周末就格陵兰岛未来发表的强硬言论，可能引发与欧盟的贸易战。【原文：US stock futures fell the most since November after a weekend of bombast from President Donald Trump over the future of Greenland threatened to spark a trade war with the European Union.】

item.title: 海特曼为房地产搬迁押注筹集26亿美元
item.description: 房地产投资公司海特曼筹集了约26亿美元资金，以把握房地产市场动荡带来的机遇，并由此完成了其有史以来规模最大的封闭式基金募集。【原文：Real estate investment firm Heitman raised about $2.6 billion to take advantage of opportunities arising from the dislocation in property markets, closing its biggest-ever closed-end fund.】

item.title: 中国陷入困境的太阳能行业面临一个闪闪发光的新问题
item.description: 过去一年间，银价已上涨逾三倍，对该国光伏产业造成了严重连锁反应。【原文：The price of silver has more than tripled in the past year, with serious knock-on effects for the country’s photovoltaic industry.】
